qas.question: When does an electric field develop across the dielectric?

answers.text: When there is a potential difference across the conductors

qas.question: Under what condition can a displacement current flow in a capacitor?

answers.text: if a time-varying voltage is applied across the leads

qas.question: What is an example of when there exists a potential difference across the conductors?

answers.text: when a capacitor is attached across a battery

qas.question: What happens to the current when a battery has been attached to a capacitor for an adequate amount of time?

answers.text: no current can flow through the capacitor

qas.question: How do charges accumulate on each plate of a capacitor after an electric field has developed across the dielectric?

answers.text: positive charge +Q to collect on one plate and negative charge −Q to collect on the other

plausible_answers.text: When there is a potential difference across the conductors

qas.question: When does an electric field not develop across the dielectric?

plausible_answers.text: a time-varying voltage is applied across the leads

qas.question: Under what condition does a displacement current never flow in a capacitor?

plausible_answers.text: when a capacitor is attached across a battery

qas.question: What is an example of when there exists a similarity across the conductors?

plausible_answers.text: positive charge +Q to collect on one plate and negative charge −Q to collect on the other plate

qas.question: How do charges stop accumulating on each plate of a capacitor after an electric field has developed across the dielectric?

plausible_answers.text: no current can flow through the capacitor

qas.question: hat happens to the current when a battery has been attached to a capacitor for an inadequate amount of time?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>When there is a potential difference across the conductors<b5_0/><a0_0/> (e.g., <a2_0><b7_0>when a capacitor is attached across a battery<b7_0/><a2_0/>), an electric field develops across the dielectric, causing <a4_0><b8_0>positive charge +Q to collect on one plate and negative charge −Q to collect on the other<a4_0/> plate<b8_0/>. If a battery has been attached to a capacitor for a sufficient amount of time, <a3_0><b9_0>no current can flow through the capacitor<b9_0/><a3_0/>. However, <a1_0>if <b6_0>a time-varying voltage is applied across the leads<b6_0/><a1_0/> of the capacitor, a displacement current can flow.
